techmeme.title: Sources: Tencent is the unidentified shareholder that raised about $206M after selling Chinese brokerage-platform Futu's American depositary shares (Bloomberg)
Sources: the DOJ is investigating Super Micro after a report by short-seller Hindenburg Research; an ex-employee accused the company of accounting violations (Wall Street Journal)
The Tor Project merges with Tails, a portable Linux-based OS focused on user privacy and anonymity; Tails says it had "outgrown its existing structure" (Paul Sawers/TechCrunch)
Researchers reported a flaw in Kia's web portal in June that let them track millions of cars, unlock doors, and start engines; Kia seems to have fixed the issue (Andy Greenberg/Wired)
Q&A with Meta CTO Andrew Bosworth on Orion, Reality Labs, building News Feed, competing with Apple, developers, the AR and VR bifurcation, Ray-Ban, and more (Ben Thompson/Stratechery)
